Directions
Prepare a boiling water bath and 5 regular mouth pint jars. (See
canning basics
.) Place lids in a small saucepan over very low heat to simmer while you prepare the pickles.
Serious Eats / Marisa McClellan
Serious Eats / Marisa McClellan
Wash and trim beans so that they fit in jars. If you have particularly long beans, cut them in half. Combine vinegar, water, and salt in a medium saucepan and bring to a boil. While the pickling liquid heats, pack the beans into the jars, leaving 1/2 inch for headspace. To each jar, add 1 clove of garlic, 1 teaspoon dill seeds, and 1 teaspoon red chile flakes.
Slowly pour the hot brine over the beans, leaving 1/2 inch for headspace. After all the jars are full, use a wooden chopstick to work the air bubbles out of the jars. Check the headspace again and add more brine if necessary.
Serious Eats / Marisa McClellan
Wipe the rims, apply lids, and rings and process in a hot water bath for 10 minutes. Let pickles sit for at least 1 week before eating.
Serious Eats / Marisa McClellan
